f6_assessments.q0: The proposal doesn't state a clear problem. Whilst PoW is quite energy-wastefull PoS doesn't consume that much energy. On the other hand each effort in this direction is needed and plans to educate about sustainability would help to spread awareness.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer could provide more information about himself, he could add how exactly he wants to do his education community programm. As of now it seams more like an idee than a product which is ready to go.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal could be more detailed. There is no clear roadmap, no succes-metrics or clear milestones. Also the is no risk-assessment. Maybe it would help to reasses the proposal and submit it in a new form for the next Fund.

f6_assessments.q0: The development of a sustainable Staking Pool by using renewable power technology to operate a staking pool is a great idea. The proposal clearly states the problem and offers a solution. This idea has a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. It would be good to elaborate in more detail how this idea would add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal does not list KPIs so it is impossible to compare them with the ones indicated in the challenge. The proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges due to lack of data.
f6_assessments.q1: It would be good to have information about the team and the work done so far as some work experience. The proposal does not provide information on how many people will work on this project and whether team members have the necessary skills, knowledge and experience to implement this idea. It would be good to show transparently who is behind this idea. The budget is presented but not broke down into identifiable items. As we do not have a clear insight into what the money will be distributed, the requested amount is not reasonable. This is a great idea but it would be good to detail the implementable plan and work out the details of actionable tasks and order execution. It would be good to develop and present a realistic timetable to complete the work and what resources are needed together with the technical aspects for the implementation of the project itself. It is good to keep in mind the idea of possible risks because what if the risks overshadow the project itself?
f6_assessments.q2: In proposal we do not find the necessary information about the roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. KPIs are also missing and should be developed and presented. The community, although this is a great idea, cannot in any way track the progress and development of the idea itself.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal addresses the challenge from the point of view by promoting smaller SPOs and stakepools using green energy. One could argue that it supports decentralisation too, since the SPO would be located in Puerto Rico and it would not running on one of the larger data centres.  
However, the current description is very brief and more details are needed on several aspects to enable a proper assessment. 
I would recommend to clarify at least the following aspects of the description: 
1. Under 'describe your solution', it says development of sustainable technologies. I assume that the proposal is to design a power supply that is based on renewable technologies. Can you describe which technologies that you have in mind, and how you plan to bridge the periods when not enough solar PV electricity is produced? (e.g. electrical grid, battery) 
2. Change the discussion under Detailed plan from Bitcoin POW to Cardano POS (Proof Of Stake). Cardano is about 1000 times more energy efficient than the POW of Bitcoin. It would be better to frame the discussion about the Cardano stakepool technology.
3. The education community program has very broad scope (e.g. food security/soverign) and the link is not clear to the stakepool operation with renewable energy. Can you explain this further? My proposal would be to focus on designing a renewable power supply for your stakepool as a first step. The other apsects could possible be addressed in later funding rounds.
4. Make a breakdown on the funding needs (cost for salaries, equipment etc).
5. Prepare a timeline for project implementation.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very limited information is provided. So please add more information about the background of the team members. 
The proposal does not contain a plan on how the project will be implemented, see my comment above. Afterwards, we can make a judgement on how likely it is the the project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
No, not at this stage. The content of the project and its plan still lacks many details, e.g. project plan, the exact content of the project. 
The project proposer need to complement the proposal with missing information for a positive opinion.
